measured_by: AI Score from Winston AI detection tool
justification: “we employ the paid premium version of Winston AI… Winston AI calculates a ‘Human Score,’… For the purposes of our analysis, we define the AI Score as '100 − Human Score', representing the estimated probability that a complaint was generated with AI assistance.”

measured_by: ACS Table S1601 proportion speaking language other than English
justification: “For the second instrumental variable, English proficiency, we used Table S1601 ‘Language Spoken at Home’… Population Speaking a Language Other Than English… This proportion serves as our second instrument to capture variations in English language proficiency across ZIP codes.”

measured_by: ACS Table S2801 proportion of households without internet
justification: “To construct the first instrumental variable, Internet access, we utilized Table S2801 ‘Types of Computers and Internet Subscriptions’… The proportion of households with limited Internet access… serving as our first instrument.”

measured_by: CFPB company response categories ‘Closed with monetary or non-monetary relief’
justification: “In our analysis, we define a successful complaint outcome as one that results in either monetary or non-monetary relief, consistent with prior literature (Dou et al., 2023).”

topic_or_construct: Perceived likelihood of providing monetary compensation
justification: “Participants rated the likelihood of offering monetary compensation… on a scale from 1 (Not likely at all) to 7 (Extremely likely).”
“For each complaint, they answered the question, ‘How clear is the complaint above?’ on a 7-point scale (1 = Not clear at all, 7 = Extremely clear).”
“Participants rated each complaint on the linguistic feature corresponding to their assigned condition: clarity, coherence, or professionalism.”
“Participants then rated each of the five complaints on… professionalism… ‘How professional is the complaint above?’ on a 7-point scale.”
